sources.autograph: Paris, Conservatoire, MS. 1292 (for title and comment, see No. 189)
sources.ms_copies_parts: Naples, Conservatorio. Two copies: 22.5.2, and 22.5.6, 'Quartetto no. 3...'; Paris, Conservatoire, a parcel of copies (see No. 189)
sources.first_edition: (1778?), Paris, Sieber: Op. 27 no. 3 (for title, see No. 191)
later_editions: (c. 1785?), Amsterdam, Hummel: Op. 11 no. 3 (for title, see No. 191)
sources.modern_edition: 1953, Milan, Ricordi: Op. 27 no. 1 (pocket score; revised by Enrico Polo). Polo has added a fourth movement taken from the quartet Op. 22 no. 6 (see No. 188)
